description: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CSA+) covers the exam objectives for this international, vendor-neutral cybersecurity certification. To improve the overall state of IT security, CSA+ validates critical knowledge and skills that are required to prevent, detect and combat cybersecurity threats.
descriptionMD: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CySA+) covers the exam objectives for this international, vendor-neutral cybersecurity certification. To improve the overall state of IT security, CySA+ validates critical knowledge and skills that are required to prevent, detect and combat cybersecurity threats. __This course has been CAQC'd and qualifies for CEU credits. [Click here](https://itpro.tv/comptia-partnership) to get an exam voucher discount.__
name: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CySA+)
subtitle: Vender-neutral cybersecurity knowledge and skills

episodes.description: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CSA+) covers the exam objectives for this international, vendor-neutral cybersecurity certification. To improve the overall state of IT security, CSA+ validates critical knowledge and skills that are required to prevent, detect and combat cybersecurity threats.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike look at concepts and utilities used to gain information on a network through environmental reconnaissance. They will talk about techniques like topology discovery, os fingerprinting, host scanning, network mapping, port scanning and more.
episodes.title: Environmental Reconnaissance

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration into the concepts and utilities to gain information on a network through environmental reconnaissance. They will look a packet capturing, service discovery, audit logs, syslog and log review and more.
episodes.title: Environmental Reconnaissance Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take a look at the concepts and practice of Network Reconnaissance. They explain what point-in-time data analysis is and how to use different analyzing tools to gather and interpret that information. They also discuss Data Analytics, data output from logs, captures, and scans, and finally cover common tools to that end.
episodes.title: Network Reconnaissance

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike explore common responses and countermeasures to address network-based threats. Specifically discussed countermeasures include Network segmentation, Honeypots, Endpoint security, ACLs, System Hardening, and Network Access Control(NAC) systems.
episodes.title: Response and Countermeasures

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike explain the purpose of practices used to secure a corporate environment. Watch here as they explore practices like Penetration Testing, Reverse Engineering, security training and exercises, and evaluating risk.
episodes.title: Corporate Environment Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike was dive into the realm of data standards and specifications as part of vulnerability management. They talk about HIPAA, FISMA, GLBA to name a few. They will also look at concepts like do-not-call-list, Can-Spam Act of 2003, corporate policies as well as data classification.
episodes.title: Vulnerability Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration of vulnerability management. They will talk like scanning frequency, scanning criteria, scope, vulnerability levels and data types.
episodes.title: Vulnerability Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration of vulnerability management. They talk about SCAP, scanning execution, remediation, critically, MOU, SLAs, degraded functionality, organizational governance and more.
episodes.title: Vulnerability Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike perform a Vulnerability scan and then analyze the output. They utilize the Nexpose Vulnerability Scanner to scan a network and then walk you through the output to identify possible vulnerabilities, false positives, exceptions. They also explain follow-up steps like validating results and determining trends.
episodes.title: Vulnerability Scanning

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration in the world of vulnerability scanning. They will look at Nessus.
episodes.title: Vulnerability Scanning Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike take a look at common vulnerabilities to be aware of in networks today. They will look at a few examples as well as looking at some of the components that can be exploited once vulnerabilities have been found such as server, end-points, routers and switches.
episodes.title: Common Vulnerabilities

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their look into common vulnerabilities that we need to be aware of. They talk about network appliances like proxies  spam filters NIPS and, NIPS, virtual infrastructure, mobile devices, VPNs and industrial control systems like SCADA, DCS and PLCs.
episodes.title: Common Vulnerabilities Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike talk about the concepts to helping to determine the impact incidents has on an organization. They explore threat classification by determining known threats vs. unknown threats, zero day, severity and prioritization, downtime as well as recovery time. They will also discuss PII, PHI, intellectual property, accounting data and mergers and acquisitions.
episodes.title: Incident Impact

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike take a look at the various forensics tools that can be used during an investigation. They will talk about forensic kits, write blockers, crime tape, chain of custody, incident response and forensics investigation suites.
episodes.title: Forensics Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike take a look at the communication process during during an incident response. They talk about stakeholders such as the CIO, CISO, incident response teams, human relations, public relations, legal advisors and role-based responsibilities.
episodes.title: Communication Process

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike dive in to common incident systems to determine the appropriate actions to support incident response. They discuss threat classification and the difference between known and unknown threats, zero day, severity and prioritization, downtime, PII, PHI and more.
episodes.title: Common Incident Symptoms

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike summarize the incident recovery and post-incident response process. Topics covered include: Call lists, Forensic Investigation suites, analysis utilities, chain of custody, hashing utilities, and log viewers.
episodes.title: Post Incident Response

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Cherokee discuss the importance frameworks such as NIST, ISO, COBIT, SABSA, TOGAF and ITIL. They also explain why companies may be faced with regulatory compliance situations. Lastly, numerous policies are mentioned as well as suggestion where to find policy templates.
episodes.title: Frameworks, Policies and Controls

episodes.description: This is a continuation where Mike and Cherokee begin by explaining the numerous types of security control needed to secure your environment. Several procedures such as continuous monitoring, evidence production and patching are also discussed. Lastly, Mike explains verifictions and quality control techniques.
episodes.title: Frameworks, Policies and Controls Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Cherokee break down issues associated with identity and access issues. Specifically, they address context-based authentication, identity and identity repositories as well as federation and single sign-on vulnerabilities. Lastly, you will see various exploits that can occur due to vulnerabilities discussed.
episodes.title: Identity Access Issues

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Cherokee discuss the relevance of analysis techniques. Just about every piece of software or hardware will offer some form of logging capabilities which be a useful to help find trends, correlations, root causes and more.
episodes.title: Security Architecture

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Cherokee explain a security fundamental called defense in depth. Mike also offers additional methods one should consider incorporating within their environments such as the separation of duty and control techniques as well as other security concepts  to provide a variety of security layers.
episodes.title: Security Architecture Part 2

episodes.description: In this show Mike and Cherokee expound on application security. With the proliferation of applications saturating the market one should be aware of the risks and techniques to mitigate those risks. Tune in to learn about various testing techniques such as web app vulnerability scans and fuzzing.
episodes.title: Application Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take you through a litany of Cybersecurity Tools that you will need to be familiar with for the CSA+ exam. They start by exploring preventative tools like IPS/IDS, Firewalls, Antivirus/Anti-malware, Web proxy, and Web Application Firewalls.
episodes.title: Cybersecurity Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take you through a litany of Cybersecurity Tools that you will need to be familiar with for the CSA+ exam. They continue by exploring collective tools like SIEMs, Network Scanners, Vulnerability Scanners, and Packet Capture utilities.
episodes.title: Cybersecurity Tools Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take you through a litany of Cybersecurity Tools that you will need to be familiar with for the CSA+ exam. They continue by exploring collective, analytical, exploit, and forensic tools like command-line utilities, monitoring utilities, intercept proxies, exploit frameworks, fuzzers, and forensic suites.
episodes.title: Cybersecurity Tools Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike demonstrate the venerable Intrusion Detection System(IDS) known as Snort. They explain how to check Snort's help system to get you started with the most common options. Then they create a custom Snort configuration and rule file. Finally they show you how to check Snort for rule violations and examine more complex rule-sets.
episodes.title: Snort

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike demonstrate the venerable packet capture and/or packet analyzer known as Wireshark. They begin by showing you how to launch Wireshark and connect to a network interface to quickly capture data. They also show you how to work with Profiles and employ Filters to more finely control Wireshark's output.
episodes.title: Wireshark

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike demonstrate the venerable network host and port scanning software known as Nmap. They begin by introducing you to Nmap's options. Then they show you how to perform common tasks like host discovery, port filtering, Scan types, OS detection Versioning, and the Nmap Scripting Engine(NSE).
episodes.title: Nmap

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take you through some practical application of the tools and techniques that they've been discussing throughout the series. Here you will see them scan a vulnerable machine and then search for ways to exploit the found vulnerabilities.
episodes.title: Practical Application

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take you through some practical application of the tools and techniques that they've been discussing throughout the series. Here they pick back up by actually exploiting the target using Metasploit and a custom script.
episodes.title: Practical Application Part 2
